content.webTitle: Jenny Colgan: View from a broad

fields.headline: View from a broad
fields.bodyText: In rather cheering news - particularly if you feel coerced into buying pieces of tit-moulded plastic with Sunday Sport dimensions for preteens this Christmas - it turns out that Barbie dolls are by far the most tortured of all toys, according to research by the University of Bath. Decapitation, burning and micro-waving are common forms of abuse and she was the most routinely vilified toy across all ages and social groupings. Nice to think it's a rejection of an impossibly sexualised, passive view of womanhood (despite the deep sea diver and doctor costumes) - a blonde built to take abuse. She also resembles those unfeasibly attractive street prostitutes that Hollywood likes to murder in B-movies. However, given that it coincides with the news that most kids are fat now, it might just be jealousy. Stuck for a Christmas present in Waterstones? You could buy the first of a proposed five books on the Peter Falconio murder trial, which - if you tried to follow it from the press reports - seemed a pretty even split as to whether he'd been killed by a drug-addled criminal drifter with blood on his shirt, or by his pretty girlfriend, who did it to have sex with someone else, ate the body and made up an extremely complex cover story involving a drug-addled criminal drifter with blood on his shirt. Quite how Joanne Lees survived being thrown from one nightmare to another is depressing to contemplate: while waiting for the trial, she had to move house in Australia eight times because of people shouting black widow-style abuse at her. I wonder how many books there would have been had she been less attractive? A man? Hadn't worn a pink vest top? And if she'd gone to prison, would she have received as many marriage proposals as blokes do when they do something depraved? In the week we learn women in their 30s are, for the first time, having more babies than those in their 20s, I remembered a question we never were told the answer to at school - in retrospect, for good reason. When Mary had the wee baby Jesus, she is popularly believed to have been between 12 and 14 years old. Teenage refugee mother having out-of-wedlock baby! The Mail would have had a field day. Merry Christmas!
